meanings.sent1: Her boredom during the lecture was obvious to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: I tried to fight off the boredom by doodling in my notebook.
meanings.sent3: To cure his boredom, he decided to count how many tiles were on the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: The endless meeting was a sea of boredom that seemed to swallow up all energy.
meanings.sent5: The boredom in the waiting room was so thick you could almost touch it.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being uninterested or lacking excitement.
meanings.sent1: The movie failed to capture my interest, leaving me drowning in boredom.
meanings.sent2: She scrolled through her phone to alleviate the boredom of waiting in line.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to spice up the party only resulted in more boredom for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The gray, rainy day seemed to amplify the sense of boredom in the air.
meanings.sent5: The boredom in the classroom was so heavy it felt like a weight on everyone's shoulders.
